questions.question: A parable is a heavenly story with an earthly meaning.
In the parable of the sower, how many different types of ground were there?
Who does the sower represent in the parable?
Who does the seed that fell among thorns represent?

choices.answer: Those who hear the word of the kingdom of God but do not understand it
Those who hear the word of God but let worries and pursuit of wealth
Those who receive word with joy, but fall away in the face of persecution
Those who hear the word of God, understand it, and put it into practice

questions.question: What happened to the seed that fell on the path?

choices.answer: It started to grow but could not take root.

questions.question: What happened to the seed that fell on rocky soil?

choices.answer: It started to grow but died.

questions.question: Why did some seed produce a crop?

choices.answer: It was a special kind of seed.
It got a lot of love.

questions.question: Why did Jesus speak in parables?

choices.answer: To confuse the people that did not believe Him
To hide the meaning of His teachings from those who wouldn't understand
To make His teachings less boring
o make it easier for the uneducated to understand His teachings

questions.question: What was the seed in this parable?

choices.answer: the hearts and minds of the people
People who spread the word of God

questions.question: Parable of the Rich Fool: A wealthy farmer finds that his land has produced good crop. What does he do with his wealth?

choices.answer: Invite the Levites, widows and orphans to share in his bounty
Give a double tithe for the year
Sell his excess harvest and become even wealthier
Tear down his barns and build bigger ones to hold all the crops

questions.question: What did the farmer decide to do in the future?

choices.answer: Use his wealth to buy more land
Answer God's call to be a prophet

questions.question: What did God say to the farmer?

choices.answer: "You fool! Your wealth will not save you from the Evil One."
"This is my Son, with whom I am well pleased."

questions.question: What is the lesson of this parable?

choices.answer: A fool and his money are soon parted.
Share generously with those in need.

questions.question: A Pharisee and a tax collector, went to the temple to pray. What was the Pharisee's prayer?

choices.answer: "Lord, here and now I will give half of my possessions to the poor!"
"God, thank you that I am not like other people: thieves, adulterers, etc.
"God, be merciful to me, a sinner!"
"Lord, lead me not into temptation, but deliver me from evil."

questions.question: What was the tax collector's prayer?

choices.answer: "God, thank you that I am not like other people: thieves, adulterers, etc.
"God, be merciful to me, a sinner!"
"Lord, here and now I will give half of my possessions to the poor!"
"Lord, lead me not into temptation, but deliver me from evil."

questions.question: Which of the men was justified - made righteous before God - by his prayer?
Which is the main lesson of the parable of the Pharisee and the Publican?

choices.answer: We should be persistent in prayer and never give up.
We should love even our enemies.
We should not judge others harshly, or God will judge us in the same way.
Humility is a virtue, but self-righteousness is a sin.

questions.question: In the parable of the prodigal son, what portion would the son receive?
What happened to the prodigal son when he returned home?

choices.answer: His father welcomed him and killed the fatted calf
His father took him back as a hired servant
His father sent him back to the pig farmer
His father welcomed him, and his brother threw a party for him

questions.question: When the Prodigal Son returned, he father gave him a robe, shoes and what other item?
After the prodigal son had spent all his money and famine had come along, what job did he get?
What did the Prodigal son ask for in advance?
Where was the prodigal's brother when the prodigal returned?
What was his brother's response to the celebration?
What was the father's final response to the older brother?

choices.answer: It is proper to make merry, and be glad.
Your brother was lost, and is found.
Your brother was dead, and is alive again.
